question: Can leuprorelin acetate be used as androgen deprivation therapy?
ideal_answer: Yes, leuprorelin acetate is being used as androgen deprivation therapy.

snippets.text: We investigated the health-related quality of life (HRQoL) of long-term prostate cancer patients who received leuprorelin acetate in microcapsules (LAM) for androgen-deprivation therapy (ADT).
Long-term ADT with LAM is a well-accepted, tolerated, effective, and low-burden treatment option for patients with advanced, hormone-sensitive PCa.
